name: Casa Tuscany Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled upon Carols B&B quite by accident while hotel-hunting. A quick look at the premises and our polite and friendly host, and the decision was made. The threatening thunderstorm and the lightning strike in the house next door, just as we were ascending the stairs to the room, merely added to the sentiment. We stayed for 3 nights, and enjoyed the nice airconditioned rooms, the fine beds, and the charming courtyard, where Carol served her homecooked breakfasts with fruits of the season. We highly recommend this place to anyone planning to spend some time in La Paz.
reviews.title: A delightful stay in a delightful place.
Excellent location
reviews.text: This beautiful BB is quiet and lovely, and the owner, Carol, is friendly and very helpful.The courtyard is unique and breakfast is delicious. The location is very convenient, a block from the Malecón and within walking distance to restaurants, cafes, shopping. The room was clean and very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went there with my team for a week-long training, and Carol made sure all our needs were covered. We felt pampered and taken care of!
reviews.title: Perfect Baja experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend Casa Tuscany for my wonderful experience, I will go next time with my family.
reviews.title: honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of our stay at Casa Tuscany.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Tuscany is one of the places you remember long after the trip. The house is very beautiful, and the owner, Carol takes care of all your needs in a very efficient way.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful house and warm hospitality

reviews.text: As other reviewers wrote, the location is really good. The house is just one block from the Malecon, and good restaurants of La Paz are in an easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Fantastico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is really beautiful and clean. When we get back to the house after a day at the beach or at the sea, the beautiful and cool garden gave us a good rest.
reviews.title: Comfort and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner Carol is armed with a lot of information, recommends the guests the best restaurants of the area and efficiently arranges a day trip as needed. The delicious and beautiful breakfast Carol prepares every morning cannot be missed.
reviews.title: Location, Location and Hospitality

reviews.text: Last year we travelled to La Paz and stayed in Casa Tuscanny. After we got back home, we missed so much the house and the burgers at Buffalito Grill that we returned this year. As expected, we had such a great time during our stay, and we wish to come back later with our whole family.
reviews.title: Simply, The Best!
Love all the hummingbirds!!
reviews.text: We recently spent two nights at the wonderful B&B while in LaPaz with friends. From the moment we stopped into the courtyard I was entranced with all the beautiful humming birds and other birds flitting around. Also the ambiance there was just so soothing. Carol, the owner, was very helpful with restaurants and the tour we went on and the breakfasts were just the best. We stayed in side by side rooms (can't remember the names) at the top of the staircase with our own little patio area. The rooms were small but very clean. It also is a good location for walking to the Malecon or just touring around. All in all it was a pleasure to meet Carol and experience her B&B.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently spent 5 days here. What a great experience! Casa Tuscany Inn is really lovely. It's location is supreme - close to the Malecon, shopping and restaurants. The room (Romeo and Juliet) was decorated tastefully - colorful, comfortable and well maintained. It was a pleasure to meet Carol. She was fun to talk with and very helpful with restaurant suggestions and setting up our venture out in the boat to see the whale sharks.
reviews.title: slice of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I especially enjoyed the courtyard where you are surrounded by plants and the birds flit around. It was the perfect place to enjoy the wonderful breakfast Carol provides and relax with a book or a glass of wine.
reviews.title: A Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is definitely a place I would love to return to.
reviews.title: wonderful haven

reviews.text: This is the third time that I've stayed at the Casa Tuscany because it's such a wonderful and relaxing, not to mention beautiful place. The rooms are lovely - colorful and impeccably kept; white glove clean and adorned with art, but not overly done. The location is perfect for taking in the attractions of La Paz - just off the Malecon and an easy walk to the downtown, restaurants, shopping and the markets. The proprietress, Carol, serves a sumptuous and scrumptious breakfast in a welcoming, comfortable, and tranquil garden area where you will delight to the sights and sounds of hummingbirds, doves, orioles and other birds that take advantage of the abundant greenery and various bird feeders.
reviews.title: Casa Tuscany, your home away from home!

reviews.text: I have been there with my sister for 2 nights and it was the best place we had stayed in during our 2-week trip: Carole is the best host one could ever imagine (extremely available and willing to help organize our trip and optimize our time), the rooms are very very cute and comfortable, the breakfast is a delight (very various food: we had the opportunity to have Danish pancakes, Mexican buritos and fres fruits and yogurt...) the location is good (1 block from the main street with all restaurants, pubs, shops etc. and the beach). In a nutshell, we highly recommand this hotel, no matters what the context of your trip is
reviews.title: We felt like we were at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Your trip to La Paz will be even more than you dreamed if you book your stay at Casa Tuscany. Carol thinks of everything to enhance your visit. And if you need anything special, all you have to do is ask. She saved the day for us by providing computer tech support that was invaluable. If you have read any of the other reviews, you will already have heard about Carol's gifts as a gracious hostess. She serves sumptious breakfasts, is very knowledgeable of places to go and things to go in the La Paz area, and in addition to information about the wide number and variety of restaurants, will steer you toward some of the best choices on the menu. Carol is a travel consultant par excellance and has personal contacts with local drivers, tour agencies and specific guides that she has vetted. She put together a whale-watching trip for us to Magdalena Bay in San Carlos that was absolutely incredible! We also enjoyed a day-long adventure to snorkel with sea lions and enjoy a shore lunch on one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Her backyard patio itself is like a bird sanctuary. We added four new birds to our life lists without leaving the inn. In short, you won't be disappointed if you choose Casa Tuscany. Carol deserves her new award as one of the best of the best.
reviews.title: Can't Be Beat!

reviews.text: Stayed there from Dec 23 - Jan 1, 2013. Can't say enough great things about the inn and Carol! Carol is a great host, fabulous cook, knows everything about La Paz and willing to help with any plans or information.
reviews.title: Casa Tuscany is a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, artsy, comfortable and authentic, from Mexican art to kitchens, to DVD players. The courtyard where breakfast is served is visited daily by hummingbirds while you're eating. Fairly priced and well maintained. Wonderful courtyards on the roof as well if you want to get away from crowds and still have sun.
reviews.title: More than a B&B!

reviews.text: The location is fantastic--one block of the malecon, where everything happens. I will definitely return!
reviews.title: Magical Experience

description: Beyond the front gate and behind the walls of Casa Tuscany lies an inn reminiscent of a Tuscan villa. All guest rooms have private entry and open out onto a central courtyard where Costa's Hummingbirds rule. These friendly fliers are very curious and often buzz guests, especially if dressed in bright colors. The Malecon, or boardwalk, is only one block away and invites guests to stroll, bicycle, roller blade, or just sit on one of the many benches to watch the sea and the sunset. Casa Tuscany is close to just about everything in La Paz, encouraging visitors to get out there and experience the local culture without the encumbrance of a vehicle. Rooms are nicely appointed and all rates include taxes and a sumptuous breakfast.
